title: People, Family & Days of the Week

meta.focus: Review of Kanji, Vocabulary, and Grammar from Lessons N5.1–N5.2.

sections.title: Part 1: Conversation Check
sections.instructions: Read each conversation and select the best answer.

items.title: Conversation 1
items.context: Rikizo and Yamakawa meet in the school hallway and check the day's schedule.

lines.jp: 今日は 何よう日ですか。
今日は 火よう日です。
やまもと先生は いますか。
いいえ、火よう日は いません。月よう日と 水よう日と 金よう日は います。

items.question: Why isn't Yamamoto-sensei at school today?
choices: Today is Tuesday, and she does not come on Tuesdays.
Today is Monday, and she only comes on Wednesdays.
Today is Friday, and she has already gone home.
items.answer: Today is Tuesday, and she does not come on Tuesdays.
items.explanation: B says 今日は火よう日です (today is Tuesday) and 火よう日はいません (she is not here on Tuesdays). She comes on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

items.title: Conversation 2
items.context: Suzuki-san asks Yamakawa about their parents.

lines.jp: やまかわさんの お父さんは どんな 人ですか。
とても やさしい 先生です。
母も 先生です。父と 母は とても いい 人です。

items.question: What do Yamakawa's father and mother have in common?
choices: They are not at home every day.
items.explanation: B says とてもやさしい先生です about the father, then 母も先生です (mother is also a teacher). Both parents are teachers.

items.title: Conversation 3
items.context: Rikizo and Yamakawa talk about having money this month.

lines.jp: 今月 お金が ありますか。
今日は ありません。金よう日は あります。
毎月 金よう日ですか。
はい。今月も 金よう日は あります。金よう日は いい 日ですね。

items.question: Does Yamakawa have money today?
choices: No, but they will have money on Friday.
Yes, they have money every day.
No, and there is no money this month at all.
items.answer: No, but they will have money on Friday.
items.explanation: B says 今日はありません (not today) but 金よう日はあります (there is some on Friday). They confirm this happens every month.

sections.title: Part 2: Grammar Scramble
sections.instructions: Construct the sentence by clicking the words in the correct order.

items.q: Yamamoto-sensei is here from Monday to Friday.
items.explanation: 月よう日 + から (starting point) + 金よう日 + まで (endpoint) + います. から marks where a range begins; まで marks where it ends. を marks direct objects of action verbs and cannot mark a time range.

items.q: My mother is also a teacher.
items.explanation: も replaces は to mean 'also' or 'too'. 母も先生です = my mother is also a teacher (same as the person just mentioned). は would simply mark 母 as the topic without the inclusive 'also' meaning.

items.q: What is your teacher's name?
items.explanation: の links two nouns possessively: 先生の名まえ = the teacher's name. は marks the topic (what we are asking about). が marks the grammatical subject; を marks direct objects — neither fits a possessive question.

items.q: Please say your name.
items.explanation: を marks the direct object of いう (to say): 名まえをいってください = please say your name. は would mark 名まえ as a topic, not as the thing being said. が marks a subject, not an object.

items.q: On Saturdays and Sundays, my father is not here.
items.explanation: と connects the two days exhaustively (Saturday AND Sunday). は marks those days as the topic. が marks 父 as the grammatical subject of the state described by いません. を marks direct objects; の marks possession — neither applies here.

passage.jp: わたしは やまかわです。
今日は 水よう日です。やまもと先生は います。
passage.en: Today is Wednesday. Yamamoto-sensei is here.

passage.jp: 先生は 月よう日と 水よう日と 金よう日は います。
passage.en: The teacher is here on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays.

passage.jp: 先生は とても やさしい 人です。
passage.en: The teacher is a very kind person.

passage.jp: 父と 母は 先生です。毎日 います。
passage.en: My father and mother are teachers. They are here every day.

passage.jp: 今月も 月よう日から 金よう日まで います。
passage.en: This month too, they are here from Monday to Friday.

questions.q: 今日は 何よう日ですか。
questions.explanation: Line 2 says 今日は水よう日です (today is Wednesday).

questions.q: 先生は どんな 人ですか。
questions.explanation: Line 4 says 先生はとてもやさしい人です (the teacher is a very kind person).

questions.q: 父と 母は 何ですか。
questions.explanation: Line 5 says 父と母は先生です (father and mother are teachers).

sections.title: Part 4: Kanji Readings
sections.instructions: Select the correct reading for the [bracketed] word.

items.q: [先生]の 名まえは なんですか。
items.explanation: 先生 (teacher) is read as sensei. 先 (N5.1) + 生 (N5.1).

items.q: [友だち]は とても やさしい 人です。
items.explanation: 友だち (friend) is read as tomodachi. 友 (N5.1) with okurigana だち.

items.q: わたしの [名まえ]は りきぞです。
items.explanation: 名まえ (name) is read as namae. 名 (N5.1) with okurigana まえ.

items.q: [毎日] やまもと先生は います。
items.explanation: 毎日 (every day) is read as mainichi. 毎 (N5.2) + 日 (N5.2).

items.q: [今月] お金が あります。
items.explanation: 今月 (this month) is read as kongetsu. 今 (N5.2) + 月 (N5.2).

items.q: [水よう日]は やまもと先生が います。
items.explanation: 水よう日 (Wednesday) is read as suiyōbi. 水 uses its on-reading すい. The days of the week use on-readings of their kanji.

items.q: [金よう日]は いい 日ですね。
items.explanation: 金よう日 (Friday) is read as kin'yōbi. 金 uses its on-reading きん (gold/money/Friday).

items.q: [父母]は 先生です。
items.explanation: 父母 (parents) is read as fubo using the on-readings of both 父 (ふ) and 母 (ぼ). The informal reading ちちはは uses kun-readings.

sections.title: Part 5: Context & Vocabulary
sections.instructions: Select the best word to complete the sentence.

items.q: はじめまして。わたしの ______ は りきぞです。
items.explanation: 名まえ (namae, name) fits: 'Nice to meet you, my name is Rikizo.' You introduce yourself with your 名まえ (name). 人生 means 'life', not 'name'.

items.q: 今日は 水よう日です。______ は います。
items.explanation: Yamamoto-sensei (やまもと先生) comes on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays. Since today is Wednesday (水よう日), she is present.

items.q: ______ と 母は とても やさしい 人です。
items.explanation: 父と母 (chichi to haha, father and mother) are described as very kind people. 父 (my father) pairs naturally with 母 (my mother) connected by と (and).

items.q: 毎月 金よう日は ______ が あります。
items.explanation: お金 (okane, money) fits: 'Every month on Fridays, there is money.' お金があります = there is money / I have money.

sections.title: Part 6: Grammar Check
sections.instructions: Choose the correct particle to complete the sentence.

items.q: 先生 ______ 名まえは なんですか。
items.explanation: の is the possessive particle: 先生の名まえ = the teacher's name. は marks a topic; を marks a direct object; が marks the grammatical subject. None of those fit a possessive construction.

items.q: 友だち ______ います。
items.explanation: が marks the grammatical subject of いる: 友だちがいます = a friend is here / there is a friend. が introduces new information. は marks a known topic; を marks a direct object; の marks possession.

items.q: 月よう日 ______ 金よう日まで います。
items.explanation: から marks the starting point of a range: from Monday. まで (already given) marks the endpoint: until Friday. 月よう日から金よう日まで = from Monday to Friday.

items.q: 父 ______ 母は 毎日 います。
items.explanation: と connects nouns in a complete list: 父と母 = father AND mother (both of them, exhaustively). は would take only one as the topic; も means 'also'; を marks a direct object.
